articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday said she urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to reach a cease-fire deal soon with Hamas so that dozens of hostages held by the militants in Gaza since Oct.
articles.title: Harris tells Netanyahu 'it is time' to get hostage deal done and end Gaza war

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris told reporters on Thursday that she’s “ready to debate Donald Trump.”She accused him of “backpedaling” away from a previous agreement for a debate hosted by ABC News on Sept.
articles.title: Harris says she's ready to debate Trump and accuses him of 'backpedaling' from Sept. 10 faceoff

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Prosecutors are urging a judge to uphold Donald Trump’s historic hush money conviction, arguing in court papers made public Thursday that the verdict should stand despite the Supreme Court’s recent ruling on presidential immunity.
articles.title: Prosecutors urge judge not to toss out Trump’s hush money conviction, pushing back on immunity claim

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and DIDI TANG
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Russian and Chinese bombers flew together for the first time in international airspace off the coast of Alaska, in a new show of expanding military cooperation that Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said Thursday raises concerns.
articles.title: Chinese and Russian bombers patrolling off Alaska raise concerns about growing military cooperation

articles.author: TRÂN NGUYỄN
articles.description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) — California Gov. Gavin Newsom ordered state agencies Thursday to start removing homeless encampments on state land in his boldest action yet following a Supreme Court ruling allowing cities to enforce bans on sleeping outside in public spaces.
articles.title: Newsom orders California state agencies to start clearing homeless encampments

articles.author: SARAH PARVINI
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Hollywood's video game performers announced they would go on strike Thursday, throwing part of the entertainment industry into another work stoppage after talks for a new contract with major game studios broke down over artificial intelligence protections.
articles.title: Video game performers will go on strike over artificial intelligence concerns

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK and MICHAEL BALSAMO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden signed into law on Thursday a bill strengthening oversight of the crisis-plagued federal Bureau of Prisons after reporting by The Associated Press exposed systemic corruption, failures and abuse in the federal prison system.
articles.title: Biden signs bill strengthening oversight of crisis-plagued US Bureau of Prisons after AP reporting

articles.author: MARGIE MASON and ROBIN McDOWELL
articles.description: Beneath the blazing summer sun on a former slave plantation, Lamont Gross and fellow prisoners stooped in long rows, picking vegetables by hand under the watchful eyes of armed guards on horseback. He said breaks were short and infrequent, with nothing to protect workers from the heat.
articles.title: Prisoners fight against working in heat on former slave plantation, raising hope for change in South

articles.author: JIM MUSTIAN and JOSHUA GOODMAN
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — In a WhatsApp chat that quickly devolved into depravity, a group of U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration agents boasted about their “world debauchery tour” of “boozing and whoring” on the government’s dime.
articles.title: Secret DEA files show agents joked about rape in a WhatsApp chat. Then one of them was accused of it

articles.author: JOHN LEICESTER
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Paris has long been a city of dreamers: Just look at the Eiffel Tower, for decades the world's loftiest structure. Audacity also underpins the French capital's plans for its first Olympic Games in a century, which open Friday with an opening ceremony for the ages.
articles.title: With big goals and gambles, Paris aims to reset the Olympics with audacious Games and a wow opening
